XSOnwvjoL9WFAz3qzq4GUA.text: This is a great place to stop in for a beer.  They have a great selection of Japanese craft beer in bottles and on-tap.  The tap selection rotates frequently to keep things fresh.  Their selection of food is also good.  The service is also great as they are very helpful with both the beer and food menu and look to get you seated no matter how busy.  The staff are knowledgeable of everything on the menu.

pr_m_6JSHy08kNefQijYIA.text: After much yelping and froing where to have dinner we somehow ended up choosing this place. Jumped off the MRT and despite the madness and mayhem of busy Somerset 313 and its surrounding malls, we were able to get a table after a short wait. This was a plus as I don't do long waits. There is not a lot of ambience here with the hustle and flow of the passing throng. However, it is made up for by a fantastic selection of beers from Japan. Some by bigger breweries and some by tiny craft breweries that I had neither seen or heard of previously. Japanese bar food was available on the menu, and the Yakitori and fried chicken was a welcome addition to the beers.

Nr33VMQO140yCH7L2qQ6yw.text: Great selection of Japanese craft beer and food is also good. We ordered several different items of the menus and shared. We loved the food, beer and service.

EWOpvwoSI0qGYWLcuN5HBg.text: Japanese craft beer? Yes please! Given how much care Japanese people put into their work - this has got to be good, right? There's a long extensive menu with a lot of interesting beers from Japan. Some are very traditional beers (i.e. there's nothing special - although they're good) but there are some that are truly unique. A beer brewed from rice? You can't tell me you've tried that anywhere else!It's in a great location as well, great patio in a busy neighbourhood that's easily accessible.  Beers are about $13 a bottle from what I remember, and I think they have specials as well. If you're a beer fan, I definitely recommend this place.

IfzL0mlz55XbAxTbWJN_nQ.text: Japanese craft beer specialist - there's a whole menu's worth of interesting beers here that you don't often or see at all at other spots!The draft beers are tasty - I had the local brew - Jungle Beer Tropical Wheat Mango & Orange... perhaps not for the purists but I like the slightly fruity/sweetness that this beer had. The Hitachino Nest ales were also tasty, and have the cutest owl logo.Food was decent - I wouldn't order the kaarage chicken again cause it was rather fatty for my liking, but we ordered the Hibiki set (12 yakitori sticks!) that was pretty filling for my party of 4. Interesting black peppery sauce it came with. We also ordered the Mozarella-Tomato yakitori, and I liked the mozarella.I like the ambience of the place in the sheltered outdoor area of 313, it's been raining so it was nice and cool and not too crowded or loud so conversation was easy.

_iV27EuaYWl5_9WU_1jb4Q.text: Best beer menu in town. The food selection has a great twist on modern Japanese food, and pairs well with the Hitachino.

Vaqwg-rTF9s8in9bdBK8lw.text: Japanese craft beer and vegetarian curry rice, a wonderful unity of booze and food. I come here for the espresso stout since they sell it cheaper than other places I've been to that serve this beer, plus they have other really unique beers like a new one I'll be trying soon which has coriander and bonito fish flakes. I was weirded out for sure when I saw the description but the waiter assured me that it doesn't taste fishy at all. He explained it was a new craft beer only for summer. It's so strange and unique, I just HAVE to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Vegetarian croquette made with pumpkin and vegetable curry rice. Oh yes, and espresso stout.

sbfQTsYNpF4D6ZMctDMcSA.text: This place is a relatively new addition to the spade of bars in the somerset area. If you want to avoid the loud music and crowd at emerald hill, this is your kinda place to have a beer with some peace. Great for dates if you actually want to talk to your date. The main attraction of this place is the variety of japanese craft beers it houses. On top of it, they also offer a spread of sake, some wine, and a full bar. There's a beer for everyone here, from their taps of sapporo, jungle beer to hitachino white ale and pale. I prefer this place wayy better than it's next door neighbor Brotzeit.

s_Dn9Ya0oJyW3RfUfCUqbg.text: we went for some drinks on a sunday funday.  it was a little warm since it was outside and not a lot of fans.  i tried the beer flight and i only enjoyed 1 of the 4 beers a friend also had a flight and she liked 2 of the 4.  I cant speak for the other parts since we only had a drink.

EbFpp-YS4mYWieE842EouQ.text: Great location, great beer, great food. Great, all-around. I am no Japanese beer connoisseur but they had quite a selection (and a great HH price for Asahi for beer newbies like me!).They have an extensive beer menu and while its not the cheapest, you can find all kinds of interesting niche craft beers. They also have quite a large food menu. They say they're known for their yakitori, which I didn't have a chance to try. We ordered off of the lunch menu, which is in the $15 range and includes a full set of soup with a salad. I had their curry rice with karaage chicken and it was the best curry rice I've had in the city so far.As far as I could tell, they only had outdoor seating so it might not be the best place when it is pouring outside or if you need to cool off from the heat. Still, its nice and breezy and it allows you to do a good bit of people-watching. It is located right outside of the western entrance to the Somerset313 building, next to the German restaurant.

lMgKfJL2LD0ju87pmrTfUg.text: This spot does a *lot* with their limited space, so they get credit for that.  The tap lines are limited but seem to rotate frequently.  They have a partnership with Hitachino which in the craft beer world is mediocre; and worse they've had some outright bad British craft beers.  On the other hand they had a recent line takeover by Shiga Kogen (a solid craft line out of Japan), so you never know.All of that being said, the venue is outside (but well covered from rain), and the izakaya-influenced menu is surprisingly varied and tasty.   As a veggie I am partial to the rather filling tofu salad and the seasonal corn inari, but my carnivorous companions enjoyed the various seafood and meat dishes.

BEwrUmTmLL0LhsY_nIL89Q.text: Offering people watching up the wazoo, JiBiru is a top notch spot to sample some cracking Japanese craft beers, sit under the Big Ass Fans™, and just watch the world go by.Located behind the busy Orchard Road shopping area, and within earshot of the MRT entrance makes this thoroughfare busy as a bee.Grab a bucket or two, or a craft draft, and settle in for a gawk and a talk!

DA4VOMM0oOhQ49jf_gxRrQ.text: Average bar - only worth going to because of the general Somerset outdoor bar atmosphere.

wo-EC7Eloeatoiki1dW9rA.text: This something as unusual as a place specializing in mainly Japanese craft beer and the selection is pretty great. I have explored some of these beers while in Japan but the craft beer trend was jot as strong when I was there so many of the ones on offer here were new to me. They are also thoroughly described in the beer list and the staff are knowledgeable so really impressed by that. Prices are perhaps a bit on the steep side but the happy hour is pretty good (at least if before 6pm).They also have some Japanese whiskey and sake as well as some beer from other countries and some ciders so most people should be able to find something to drink here. Of course they also serve food and it is good and simple Japanese food. I sampled several of the dishes and it is good solid Japanese food, my favorite was the curry but I would not come for the food but rather the beer selection and I may or may not have some food. The locations is central, right by Somerset tube in the mall 313@Somerset.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Gyoza
Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Curry

PlZeg_h5f2F86krOGfkJRw.text: As a travelling beer snob I was super pumped to find a place like this on vacation.  If you want to get your hands on some awesome Japanese microbrews look no further.It was pretty packed on a Friday night but I was able to find a corner of a table, and I was surprised by the selection of beers.  The beers were all great, lots of varieties, styles and microbrews.  Most beers are bottled so if you are a fan of draught beer than you will be disappointed.My two issues are: 1) the beer menu was organized loosely by brewery and not by style, they are not cross-referenced anywhere so you have to flip through a lot of pages to narrow down decisions, beer snobs like to see styles of beers grouped together. 2) Food was not at the level of the beers, beers were 5 stars, food was 3 stars, sorry but I am use to yakitori style foods that make you want to stay, eat and drink moore.If you down with beer, this is the place.  Bring your wallet though, this is in one the pricey areas of Singapore.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Yakitori skewers combo of chicken, pork and veggies
Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Karage chicken

G2Vh9PE4-MDDVpRmTIU_tQ.text: My fav to grab a beer place in town currently. I like their Japanese craft beer and Jap fried chicken. Minus one as it can get rather humid sitting out there.You may call them in advance to ask whether their tv is showing the sports channel you would like to watch as well. :)

MSxPLJGYx3zqaFM4V5qzfw.text: Five stars because their selection of Japanese craft beers is fantastic. In their selection is Shigakogen IPA, among the best (best beer for me) in the world. Their yakitori isn't half bad either (and reasonably priced). The location isn't going to please everyone, but it is good for people watching.

ddnJccGW8fSIyL2mkbfqPQ.text: JiBiru Craft Beer & Yakitori Bar maybe one of my favourite place on earth!More than 40 Japanese beers from microbreweries available in drafts or bottles! Selection of beers that I can only dream of back home. And paired with yakitori from Saitama region north of Tokyo with sauces directly imported from Hibiki yakitori restaurants of Higashi-Matsuyama. I know what I want to order... I want one of those Hitachino Draft serves in Weizenbier glass with that cute owl logo! I Unfortunately they were out of Red Rice Ale or the Amber Ale. Hitachino Nest Dai Dai IPA ended up being the drink of the evening!We also ordered Edamame and Yakitori which were both really good. So many beers I want to try. Just wish they have 3 oz samplers options or I should get more people to come drinking with me next time! Come before 6 pm for the best deal $10 VS $15 after 8 pm!! I should have started drinking much much early! You know who can resist specials?I am dreaming of a taste of Hitachino Nest XH (8%) A robust Belgian style Brown Ale made with extra malt and hops and matured in Shochu casks for over 6 months. I wonder how this will taste like!or Kinshachi Matcha Draft (Green Tea Beer)or....Until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore

odsQjGDLYLnqf9kHk0N7lw.text: Amazing selection of Japanese beer that I didn't even see in Japan! Well described too - some of the more strange ones are pretty expensive though it makes sense.The collection of Hitachino Nest beers are a good enough reason to stop by.Oh and the lunch specials where well priced and tasted good as well :)

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore

wQ3pQm7Jx1PWQDxnEOoXeg.text: I would move to Singapore for JiBiru.  Well, I would move there anyway, but I digress.  What a fantastic concept to specialize in the growing craft beer offerings from Japan.  The presence of a place like this speaks volumes to the growing craft beer culture emerging in Singapore, which has improved dramatically in the 2 years since my last visit.Prior to my visit to JiBiru, my knowledge of Japanese craft beer was limited to Hitachino.  While they do have a lengthy list of options from that brewery (both on tap and in bottles), they also have pages and pages from 7-8 other Japanese producers.  In addition just to round things out, they carry a few European and Australian beers as well.  My colleague and I were only able to sample a fraction of what was offered, requiring a few returns to try out the rest of the list.Although we only got a couple of small plates (pan fried gyoza and chicken wings), the food was quite delicious and pairs well with the beer.Service was just OK.  More often than not, we had to flag down our waiter to order more beer, even though the place was less than half full.People watching is quite excellent, as JiBiru is situated near one of the entrances to the 313@Somerset mall.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. View of the bar

LCv_Ll8B6HhPSIBacZ8gkA.text: Those who have met me know my love towards craft beers and most of the places that serve them. I'm usually an instant fan and seeing a review of such places below 4 stars usually means I've finally become annoyed enough to provide feedback via a review.It's definitely not my first time here but my previous experiences did not have service issues because I happened to be there during off-peak "happy hour" before the main crowd comes in. While it was far from packed tonight, the lapse in service became quite evident.I stopped by with Gold Elite Nik T. and Sweet Elite Linda L. for a beer and a good conversation after our dinner with Cindy L. and Ning.*******10 minutes to get our order in.5 minutes for Linda L. to receive her order.15 minutes of chatting without anything else arriving.5 minutes before we got someone's attention and to find out that they RAN OUT of our orders...and we were never informed about it.Nik T. looked at his watch and decided to downsize from 500 ml to 300 ml. We both ordered something else that they said was available.15 minutes of chatting without anything else arriving.5 minutes before we got someone's attention again and NOW found out that they CAN'T serve the new draft due to fizzy issues with the keg...and offered a ton of apologies.Nik T. downsized all the way and decided to go dry while I finally settled for the same drink as Linda L. It arrived in less than 5 minutes.Linda L.'s drink became warm while she waited for ours to arrive. Nik T. ended up leaving with just a sip of hers. I ended up having one instead of going dry like Nik T. so that Linda L. didn't end up having a brew herself.BUT WAIT...if that wasn't enough to end the night, our bill...was wrong. We were billed for our initial order. Gold Elite couldn't take it anymore...and gave immediate feedback. I just smiled...said it was okay...and got ready to review this place.*******Thankfully, I waited a bit...and managed to justify in my mind that they deserved 3 stars at least for their product. But seriously, their staff needs some training yeah? This isn't a Kopitiam...and even then, Kopitiams don't pull this kind of crap.Yelp 100: 20/100

E1jPYMgmWbWKSD5jS6TDFA.text: Yakitori salad was excellent. Beer is kind of OK. Nice place to refresh yourself in this crowded place.

0xG3VFoEpRZsHqXAEcLzMw.text: When seeing that there was a craft beer place in Singapore I had to try it. I was pretty disappointed with there Japanese craft beers. I had a sampler of 4 out of 5 different types, I didn't care for any of them. I then tried a Mocha Amaretto beer they had in a bottle, took about 3 sips then bought a different beverage. The last drink I tried was a mango Apple cider which was actually really refreshing being that it is only outdoor seating in Singapore weather. I tried the smoked duck breast(really bland), the Mochi cheese age( not bad when paired with duck breast), and the Curry croquettes. The curry croquettes are to die for, definitely would recommend them with the cider. All else I wound pass on.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore

oDf1940CZIam5Zu0_XqCxw.text: JiBiru specializes in Japanese beers, and they have the most extensive selection I have seen outside of Japan.  Actually, even i Japan I'm not sure if there are many places that carry 60 Japanese craft beers in bottles plus 5 on draft.  Anyway, they have a sampler of 4 beers on draft (all from Hitachino) which is the way to go if you would like to try a few.  I'm not the biggest fan of HItachino though (except for their espresso stout), so for me it was just ok.  Their selection by the bottle was better though.   I tried an Imperial IPA from Minoh, which was a great example of the style - strong, bitter, and full of flavor with an ABV of 9%. I could drink it all the time, except for the fact that it's so hot here, and that the pub is outdoors, with very little cooling.  They also carry some nice craft beers from the world including some of my faves (Rogue, La Trappe, etc) as well as sake, whiskey and shochu.  JiBiru also specializes in yakitori, and the chicken skewer I had was very tasty - perfectly cooked chicken with just the right amount of char and with a sauce that wasn't overly salty or sweet.   The one thing that could improve here is the service though.  With the number of people working here, I found the service to be strangely inattentive or rather focused on one table only  Maybe they were celebs?  No idea, but in any case, JiBiru is a great place to see what Japanese craft breweries are doing these days with some tasty food to boot.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Draft Beer sampler!

jVJMh-eUB7tkGp8CSGwg_w.text: I've only been here for lunch - didn't even know this was a beer place. Their lunches are quite OK quality-price wise. A bit noisy but this is the Somerset shopping area.

6-ED5ZGP6wZQfVNTNDmgWA.text: My husband loved craft beer so why not try Japanese craft beer.  The menu was so fun just to look through and decide which beers to try.  Luckily our server was there with great recommendations.  So we went with the Hitachino Nest Espresso Stout.  It did not disappoint.  We also tried the Jungle Beer Tropical Wheat Mango & Orange.The food was pretty good as well.  Some fun little skewers to go along with the beer was just right.  This was a good meal to end 3 weeks of traveling.

DDxM9I2Blj26hdkKC61M5Q.text: This place helped me realize how good the craft beer scene in Japan was becoming. Hitichino Nest and Yona Yona are the highlights, but there's a lot to choose from. They also have some local stuff (Jungle Beer, usually on draft), and on my last trip I noticed an improving selection of craft beer in bottles from Australia, Europe, and the U.S. Prices are reasonable:  normally $11-$15, but a little cheaper during their 2-tiered happy hour (before 6, and 6-8). It's also a nice, mellow, breezy place to chill out. In contrast, Brotzeit next door is always a little chaotic. Access is great for the MRT crowd. It's just a few steps outside of Somerset.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore

mJUFViGLO8PB1uPEc5fz2w.text: Ji-Biru offers a good range of Japanese imported beers. Some of these beers cannot even be found in the Japanese supermarkets around! One of our favorites is the chocolate bottled beer, but it comes in only seasonally. It has a really nice packaging, like what you expect to get on a Japanese beer. This little bar started along with the starting of the mall, and has since updated its menu with a good amount of food items, and expanded the choice of imported beer. This I think is a really good sign for any business, having business owners are willing to progress and make changes for the consumers. I guess they have figured out that Singaporeans still like to munch while drinking. However on the downside, the staff are not very attentive. They will not attend to you until you go and take a seat yourself, from several of my personal experiences. Perhaps it is their style of service, but I cannot really get used to it. Environment wise, I actually like the open atmosphere. That's when I can do my favorite activity - people watching! Perfect spot to chill and watch people as they walk along.

photos.caption: Photo of JiBiru Craft Beer Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Seasonal chocolate beer

0SuZymkkww2eUre3g2jbKw.text: Love the amazing choice of beers. I got cheeky and tried some outlandish chocolate beer which wasn't great. Overall the happy hour is great and it's a great place to experiment with new drinks.
